item.title: bash extglob
item.description: Bash has many advanced features that may not be enabled by default, and as an avid wildcard wielder I find extglob especially useful. I use inverse pattern matching most frequently, for example: $ ls bar baz foo.jpg quux ^ $ ls !(*.jpg) bar baz quux To enable extglob, simply run: $ shopt -s extglobIf the extglob shell option is enabled using the shopt builtin, several extended pattern matching operators are recognized.
